title: drburmaster
author: drburmaster
content: Hello allSorry to be the new guy at this. I was given a promo code to use for a site I'm lookin at called Blogxp.com, and I am having some trouble figuring out how to be able to transfer the funds to my actual bank account. Any help would be niceThank you muchdrburmaster

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Seems like you made an error in the site, I can’t find any site like blogxp(.)comEdit: Do you plan on buying the domain? If yes… then you should state location where you want to send the funds from to your account that way it will be easier for users to provide solution to your problem.

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: That domain site is for sale so what promo code are you talking about?https://www.hugedomains.com/domain_profile.cfm?d=blogxp.com

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Could tell us how did you stumble upon this website?I understand that there must've been a typo error on your post but I have a feeling we're talking about another obscure website... which if I have to be honest, not a good sign.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: drburmaster on December 05, 2023, 10:04:50 PMSorry to be the new guy at this. I was given a promo code to use for a site I'm lookin at called Blogxp.com, and I am having some trouble figuring out how to be able to transfer the funds to my actual bank account. Any help would be niceIt's a scam, mate... A stranger gives you a promo code and a link to the site he built. Once you enter the promo code, you will actually see some funds in your account, but the funds are not real and then when you try to withdraw, they will ask you to send Bitcoins in order to activate or verify your account, or sometimes they tell you that the bitcoin you are sending is a tax you are supposed to pay. Once you send those Bitcoins. That's how you get scammed. You will never receive anything.Quote from: Potato Chips on December 05, 2023, 10:27:17 PMCould tell us how did you stumble upon this website?Probably the same guy who gave him the promo code.

comments.author: cryptomaniac_xxx
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on December 05, 2023, 11:01:54 PMQuote from: drburmaster on December 05, 2023, 10:04:50 PMSorry to be the new guy at this. I was given a promo code to use for a site I'm lookin at called Blogxp.com, and I am having some trouble figuring out how to be able to transfer the funds to my actual bank account. Any help would be niceIt's a scam, mate... A stranger gives you a promo code and a link to the site he built. Once you enter the promo code, you will actually see some funds in your account, but the funds are not real and then when you try to withdraw, they will ask you to send Bitcoins in order to activate or verify your account, or sometimes they tell you that the bitcoin you are sending is a tax you are supposed to pay. Once you send those Bitcoins. That's how you get scammed. You will never receive anything.Quote from: Potato Chips on December 05, 2023, 10:27:17 PMCould tell us how did you stumble upon this website?Probably the same guy who gave him the promo code.This is also my thoughts when I read the post, and when I try to connect, it says:So OP be very careful about this site, on the other hand, I would ignore it already, you don't want to be the next victim of scam here, just saying.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: The domain, which the OP posted, might really be wrong – either spelling mistake or something else, but I think we understand, where the OP is heading. Someone online might have directed the OP to create an account on a broker site and hand him a promo code, which, when entered in the provided space in the OP's account, a specific amount will be funded in the account. The OP might be looking for means to withdrawal that audio money from his wallet or personal bank account.  Und if what I'm sensing is correct, then this is a total scam and the OPs need to be careful, as they will requires him to make some deposit in another for him to be allowed to withdrawal the awarded to him as promo, which we all know, how such ends. So, if you are to come back to this thread and you know someone gave you the code and requests you make payment before you can withdrawal, please disengage from it, as you will end up losing money. There is no free money on the Internet.
